alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 416 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Maes, or 23 miles south of Wagon Mound, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Maes and Trujillo. This includes State Road 104 between Mile Markers 18 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Northeast Highlands
